title: Drawing, "Design for a Tripod Candlestick Base", 1520–43
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk, squared on cream paper
markings: Watermark: H within a shield (not in Briquet or Heawood)
inscribed: Annotated:  'Ligozzi' in graphite, upper left of recto; 'Di mano del Ligozzi' in pen and brown ink on verso; 'S. 138' in red crayon, on verso
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, Mass.; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Mantelpiece featuring a shield with drapery, depicting an eagle on one side and horizontal bands on the other.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for a Tripod Candlestick Base", 1520–43.Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk, squared on cream paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-8111.
